article_title: Switzerland Signs Pact That Promises to Erode Banking Secrecy
article_text:
ZURICH—Switzerland signed onto an international agreement for sharing financial information with dozens of other countries that promises to further erode a hallmark of the Alpine nation's banking laws: secrecy.

On Tuesday, Switzerland joined nearly 60 other countries that have signed an Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development convention on exchanging data for tax purposes, the OECD said in a statement. The tax...

article_metadata.article.origheadline: Switzerland Agrees to Share Bank Information With Other Countries

article_summary:
ZURICH—Switzerland signed onto an international agreement for sharing financial information with dozens of other countries that promises to further erode a hallmark of the Alpine nation's banking laws: secrecy.
On Tuesday, Switzerland joined nearly 60 other countries that have signed an Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development convention on exchanging data for tax purposes, the OECD said in a statement.
